image.altText: Casuarina Prison barbed wire sunset

props.synopsis: The first youth custodial officer to find Cleveland Dodd unresponsive in his cell tells a coronial inquest how those working in Unit 18 inside Perth's Casuarina Prison believed it was set up for failure. WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: Youth wing in adult prison was 'chaos' and 'set up to fail', officer tells inquest into teenager's death

image.altText: A man in a black suit leaves a court building, sheltered by a bright yellow umbrella and followed by members of the media.

props.synopsis: Former Seven Network producer Taylor Auerbach testified this morning in the Federal Court as part of Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case, which is continuing into the afternoon.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case continues in the Federal Court, after evidence from former Seven producer

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Lehrmann's lawyer queries $750 price tag for two days of drugs and sex
Auerbach wanted to do 'damage' to former employer: Justice Lee

image.altText: Two pictures of two separate men, both wearing suits outside court.

props.synopsis: Network Ten alleges the Seven Network paid Bruce Lehrmann hundreds of dollars for cocaine as "pre-production expenses" before he agreed to give an exclusive interview to a current affairs program.

title.children: 'Pre-production expenses': Invoice allegedly sent by Bruce Lehrmann for drugs, sex workers presented to court

image.altText: Police officer walking along a marina carrying a large box wrapped in brown paper

props.synopsis: A 28-year-old gambling addict involved in an attempt to import 2.4 tonnes of cocaine into Western Australia is sentenced to more than 14 years in jail.

title.children: Gambling addict involved in $100 million cocaine bust linked to Mexican cartel jailed for 14 years

image.altText: composite picture showing a road flooded and passengers getting of a small aircraft

props.synopsis: While local roads remain cut off by floodwaters, Tjuntjuntjara residents forced to wait for weeks in Kalgoorlie-Boulder are finally back in their hometown thanks to a series of chartered flights.

title.children: Residents of one of Australia's most remote communities are flown home after weeks stranded by floods

image.altText: A collection of household food items and appliances sitting inside a tent.

props.synopsis: When her house burnt down, Kristine Meakins and her four children were left with nowhere to go. They now live in a tent in a Perth caravan park — yet another sign of a housing crisis that shows no signs of easing.

title.children: Where do you go when you can't afford a rental and no longer have an address to call home?

image.altText: Smoking chimneys behind fence

props.synopsis: Just 57 mega polluters are responsible for the bulk of the world's greenhouse gas emissions and most big fossil fuel players have increased, rather than decreased, their output since the Paris Agreement in 2015, a staggering new report finds.

title.children: A mere 57 mega polluters produce bulk of the world's greenhouse gas emissions, new analysis shows

image.altText: A composite photo of the seven aid workers who died in the Israeli air strikes.

props.synopsis: The seven aid workers killed in Israeli air strikes on Monday are described as "the best of humanity", as their loss is felt around the world and sends another chill through humanitarian aid groups in Gaza.

title.children: 'The best of humanity': What we know about the seven aid workers killed in Israeli air strikes this week

image.altText: A Brisbane Lions player flies over the top trying to make contact with the ball as two Kangaroos players grimace.

props.synopsis: Brisbane and North Melbourne head to Norwood Oval desperate for a win, while Port Adelaide will be hoping to ring in Gather Round with a victory over resurgent Essendon. Follow live.

title.children: Lions and Roos battle to get off the mark in first game of Gather Round double-header

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: QT: Lions make a hot start and lead Roos by 33
Melbourne's Kysaiah Pickett handed one-game suspension

image.altText: Image of council rangers and police on patrol in the Kalgoorlie CBD.

props.synopsis: Jock Barker, mayor of the town of Claremont, has suggested council rangers could be 'upskilled' and given the power of arrest to address local crime issues.

title.children: Claremont mayor proposes arrest powers for rangers amid frustration over crime

image.altText: A wide view of a crossing point between Israel and Gaza shows a sign saying "Welcome to Erez crossing".

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu speak, days after an IDF strike killed aid workers — including an Australian — delivering food in Gaza.

title.children: Israel announces it will allow 'temporary' aid through northern Gaza after Biden threatens change in US policy

image.altText: The top of a vehicle, with a large blast hole in it, seen from above

props.synopsis: The Australian government is briefed on Israel's "independent investigation" into an air strike that killed seven foreign aid workers, including an Australian, in Gaza.

title.children: Australia briefed on IDF's 'independent investigation' into the deaths of seven aid workers in air strike

image.altText: A crowd of people sitting on grass and a smaller group in a pool watching a performance on stage, forested hills in the b/g

props.synopsis: Tasmania's MONA FOMA event has been "killed" by its founder after 16 years, with the much-loved music and arts event joining the list of canned festivals.

title.children: MONA FOMA calls it quits, with founder admitting 'spell has worn off'

image.altText: He stands on a brick wall and speaks to the crowd below

props.synopsis: West Australian Fisheries Minister Don Punch acknowledges the South Coast Marine Park "does bring out some pretty passionate views", after climbing onto a brick wall to address hundreds of Esperance locals demanding answers.

title.children: 'We're the sacrificial lambs': Angry Esperance protesters question fisheries minister on marine park

image.altText: Australian and Aboriginal flying flags side-by-side.

props.synopsis: A mother who requested her children be allowed to "sit silently" during the national anthem claims one was given detention by a private Christian school for refusing to stand.

title.children: Mother removes Aboriginal children from school following 'ultimatum' on standing for national anthem

image.altText: Seven Network's logo on a building

props.synopsis: Seven executives are dealing with escalating reputational damage that threatens the future of the Spotlight program, amid allegations made in court about payments from the network for drugs and sex workers in its efforts to secure an interview with Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's interview could bring down Spotlight and risks what remains of Seven's reputation

image.altText: several men erecting a timber frame, behind them the bare hill can be seen

props.synopsis: A group of friends, dismayed about climate change, bought the most degraded piece of farmland they could find. Not to live on, or to make money from, but to transform into the bushland it once was.

title.children: They pooled their money to buy an 'ugly' hill. Twenty years later, they're calling it 'paradise'

image.altText: A building standing on an angle after an earthquake

props.synopsis: Two Australians are among the missing as Taiwan's rescue workers continue to look for survivors and trapped individuals after the island's biggest earthquake in a quarter of a century.

title.children: Two Australians missing as Taiwanese rescuers try to reach scores trapped in tunnels after quake

image.altText: Warren Entsch, dressed in a suit with a red tie, walks past windows that show deciduous trees outside

props.synopsis: Federal Liberal MP Warren Entsch announced a grant to a charity that was presided over by his wife and registered to an association that failed to file any of the required financial reports to the regulator.

title.children: A federal MP announced a $4,000 grant to a charity overseen by his wife, which was later found to be defunct

image.altText: Crash1

props.synopsis: Reigning Tour de France winner Jonas Vingegaard and Australian Jay Vine are among several riders taken to hospital after an awful crash during a race in Spain.

title.children: Horrific crash sees Australian star suffer fractures in his spine as Tour de France champ is rushed to hospital

image.altText: Afsoun Rastegari wearing large headphones and looking into the camera while waiting at a train station.

props.synopsis: Employers are stepping up their game to entice staff back into the office. But, not all perks are created equal, with some — like offering a longer holiday — proving more effective than others.

title.children: Companies are trying to convince staff to stop working from home, and the office perks are getting creative

image.altText: Bob Iger points at the camera wearing a suit while standing next to Emily Blunt in a white puff dress on the red carpet.

props.synopsis: A years-long stand-off between two men over the future of Disney has finally come to an end. This is what we know about how chief executive Bob Iger vanquished investor Nelson Peltz.

title.children: Disney's astonishingly well-paid CEO has vanquished his rival. But a succession drama still looms

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair, a black t-shirt and orange skirt stands next to the carey park child and parent centre sign.

props.synopsis: Data from the latest Australian Early Development Census shows kids in the town of Bunbury are behind in developing vital behavioural skills, but a childcare coordinator hopes a grant application to secure a specialist will help overcome that.

title.children: Children lagging behind in the classroom in WA's South West amid applications for specialist funding

image.altText: Cheese sits on shelves in the factor.

props.synopsis: Australian consumers are buying more artisanal varieties as the price of a block of grocery store cheese reaches a two-year high.

title.children: Shoppers turning to alternative cheeses as supermarket prices soar

image.altText: Parramatta River flooding

props.synopsis: The NSW SES says there is potential for major flooding later tonight as conditions in the state worsen.

title.children: People urged to stay indoors as conditions in NSW expected to worsen tonight

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: BOM issues flood warning for Hawkesbury and Nepean rivers
NSW SES advises people not to go outside
More than 100 flights cancelled at Sydney Airport

image.altText: Flooding at Blackall, Queensland

props.synopsis: Up to 100 millimetres of rain has drenched areas near Charleville in south-west Queensland in the last 24 hours, causing the Warrego River to swell.

title.children: Major flood warning issued for parts of Queensland, with heavy falls to impact south-east over weekend

image.altText: Aerial photograph of planes parked at airport gates.

props.synopsis: Airlines make most of their profits from air travel, right? Turns out, much of the value of these companies comes from operating in the financial realm.

title.children: Money for nothing: How airlines are making billions out of loyalty programs

image.altText: An elderly man in glasses sits in front of a blank wall.

props.synopsis: Ridsdale has been in prison since 1994 for the abuse of more than 70 children in Victoria. He was sentenced for the eighth time last year and is likely to die behind bars.

title.children: Notorious paedophile priest Gerald Ridsdale facing 62 new sexual abuse charges

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff speaks to media.

props.synopsis: The ACT Integrity Commission is assessing allegations about the conduct of Walter Sofronoff, who presided over the inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: Conduct of head of inquiry into Bruce Lehrmann's prosecution referred to ACT Integrity Commission

image.altText: A man looks straight ahead with green tinted sunglasses on

props.synopsis: Kristian White is was committed to stand trial on November 11 on one count of manslaughter after the death of nursing home patient Clare Nowland.

title.children: NSW Police officer pleads not guilty over nursing home taser death

image.altText: Ryan Gury at a drone racing event

props.synopsis: A small community of hobby drone racers, chasing a need for speed, unintentionally made a "terrifyingly powerful" weapon that has changed the world.

title.children: Ryan was building the fastest racing drones in the world. And then the military called

image.altText: A man sits at a desk surrounded by computer screens. Two rows of screens overhead show stocks.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market posted its third loss in four days to finish the shorter Easter trading week down 1.6 per cent, following comments from Federal Reserve officials suggesting rate cuts may come later this year, or even next.

title.children: As it happened: ASX ends the week lower after Wall Street drops, IAG hit for widespread staff underpayments

image.altText: Police walk along a street at night in Alice Springs.

props.synopsis: South Australia Police will send 20 officers to Alice Springs following a request from the NT police commissioner to help continue "high-visibility policing" in the town.

title.children: South Australia to send officers to Alice Springs to assist with youth curfew, emergency response

image.altText: A film still of Dev Patel, smiling up at a woman. He is lying in her lap, with other people seated around them.

props.synopsis: Dev Patel launches himself as a legitimate action star in his directorial debut with this violent revenge saga, steeped in Hindu legend.

title.children: Dev Patel goes for broke as a vicious underdog filled with righteous fury in his directorial debut
